subject: Fashion
title: Age and Dressing Expectations
description: A quick, practical guide to Age and Dressing Expectations.

hook.text: At some point, society decides you're 'too old' for ripped jeans. Nobody can say exactly when.

buildup.text: Unwritten rules pressure older adults to dress 'age-appropriately'â€”code for muted, modest, and invisible.

discovery.text: Studies show older adults who dress expressively report higher self-esteem and better social engagement.

twist.text: The 'dress your age' rule benefits brands. It pushes older consumers toward safe, replaceable basics.

climax.text: Age norms in fashion erase individuality. The real rule: dress for how you feel, not your birth year.

punchline.text: There's no age limit on self-expression. Wear what you want.

quiz.question: What do studies show about older adults who dress expressively instead of 'age-appropriately'?
options: They are judged more harshly and experience greater social isolation
They show no measurable difference in well-being compared to others
They report higher self-esteem and better social engagement
